posts.post_content:
Cybercod:  
Obviously, it's good in a black/green deck to get the color you need.  
The advantage it has over [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse) is that the land doesn't come taped. So it's a Forest or a Swamp with no tempo loss at the cost of a single life.  
Plus, as [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse) it can be used to pump up a blocking landfall creature since the effet can be used at instant speed.
posts.html:

Posted By: HairlessThoctar (1/16/2010 6:07:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Enemy fetchlands couple amazingly well with [Knight of the Reliquary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of the Reliquary )  and [Lotus Cobra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Cobra). actually there is a very large number of bonuses to having a land that searches for 1 of 2 lands, thinning your library, letting you shuffle, putting a land in your graveyard and so on. a very diverse land. Now all they need to do is bring the border fetchlands back into type again.
posts.html:
Enemy fetchlands couple amazingly well with Knight of the Reliquary and Lotus Cobra. actually there is a very large number of bonuses to having a land that searches for 1 of 2 lands, thinning your library, letting you shuffle, putting a land in your graveyard and so on. a very diverse land. Now all they need to do is bring the border fetchlands back into type again.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: ArKive (10/17/2009 2:02:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Hairless Thoctar: Ok, thanks! I thought it'd be something like that, but I couldn't find any rule to suggest that the types were seperated.
  
   
Anyway, this cycle is amazing. They are the best dual lands in standard right now, rivaled only slightly by the M10 duals. In extended they are even better, capable of searching for a Ravnica Block dual land. In vintage and legacy thay can search for an Alpha dual, making them still better. Cards that excel in every format while they're legal are extremely rare, though [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) and [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf) come to mind. These lands are arguably even more format-defining than Goyf or Bolt. Indubitably good.
